short_summary: The Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) requires services related to placing, lifting, removing, maintaining, and servicing buoys through local Contractors in Newfoundland.
description:
The contract is for the delivery of buoy services in an inland water environment.

The scope of work encompasses maintenance and repair, removal and replacement of buoys, including floating and submersible buoys.

Any existing investigative and preparatory work associated with the current "Buoy Pull and Assist" contract(s) will not be carried-over or duplicated.

The Contractor will need to provide equipment and labour to execute the scope of work for Areas I and II as outlined in Annex A.

The Contractor must be able to assist with the collection or provision of toddler boats at such time as required, but the Toddler Boats will be assessed and assessed/used for control operations in protecting these areas by the Fish and Oceans (DFO) authorities.

Responsibilities of the Contractor will include, but not be limited to: Sunday driving, two-way communication and Air-Ground radio Help overcrowded locations/docking waters/Reference Guidelines and relocation.

full_summary:
Netflix-impossible

**Buoy Services - Newfoundland Tender Announcement**
=====================================

### General Information

*   **Contract Number**: cb-5189-78188138
*   **Publication Date**: 2023-05-03
*   **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-06-02T14:00:00
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: 2023-07-03
*   **Expected Contract End Date**: 2025-07-02

### Tender Description

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada are seeking a contractor for buoy services. The contractor will be responsible for placing, lifting, removing, maintaining, and servicing buoys in Newfoundland.

### Requirements

*   The contractor must have experience in providing buoy services.
*   The contractor must have a valid license to operate a vessel.
*   The contractor must have the necessary safety equipment and personnel on board.
*   The contractor must comply with all relevant regulations and laws.

### Tender Package

The tender package includes:

*   Request for Proposal (RFP) document
*   Appendix 1 to Annex A document
*   Addendum document

### Contact Information

*   Name: John Gordon
*   Email:  [john.gordon@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:john.gordon@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
*   Phone: 14038099785

### Online Access

The tender documents can be accessed online at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca)

**Please note that the tender closing date is 2023-06-02T14:00:00. The submission of late offers will not be accepted.** ( link results in a 404 error; please modify to a valid website)
